meanings.definition: A gentle sheen or soft glow.
meanings.sent1: The moonlight cast a lovely lustre on the calm lake.
meanings.sent2: The candle flickered, adding a warm lustre to the room.
meanings.sent3: The fireflies danced in the night, creating a magical lustre around them.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a lustre that brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The dew on the petals added a delicate lustre to the flowers.

meanings.definition: A quality that makes something interesting or exciting.
meanings.sent1: The mystery of the old house added a certain lustre to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: His adventurous spirit brought a unique lustre to the group.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist gave the story an intriguing lustre.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for life added a vibrant lustre to her personality.
meanings.sent5: The rare gemstone had a captivating lustre that caught everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A shiny appearance on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The polished silver had a brilliant lustre that reflected the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The glossy magazine cover had a glossy lustre that stood out on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The freshly waxed car had a gleaming lustre that made heads turn.
meanings.sent4: The crystal chandelier sparkled with a dazzling lustre in the ballroom.
meanings.sent5: The smooth marble floor had a luxurious lustre that made it look expensive.

meanings.definition: To make something shiny or bright.
meanings.sent1: She used a cloth to lustre the antique silverware before the dinner party.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler carefully lustred the gemstone to enhance its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The magician lustred his wand before the performance, adding a mystical touch.
meanings.sent4: The artist lustred the painting with a special varnish to protect it.
meanings.sent5: He decided to lustre his shoes to make them look brand new.
